main event: A meeting was held to discuss the Air Force philosophy and policy regarding the Unidentified Flying Objects Program on February 17, 1959.
interesting points: Dr. J. Allen Hynek suggested the meeting to discuss his views on the UFO Program and his personal problem of adverse publicity., The Air Force concluded that the term 'Unidentified Flying Objects' should be reconsidered due to its negative connotations., It was proposed that the program should focus on improving public relations and educating the public about UFOs., A significant increase in UFO sightings was recorded in 1952, attributed to heightened public interest., The panel recommended that investigators receive better training and that the investigation process be revamped for accuracy and thoroughness.
witness description: Members associated with the Air Force UFO Program, including scientists and military personnel.
